text:
33cl bottle shared.Appearance: A dark very hazy orange with a nice big head, when pouredo in, however the retention is very bad. And there is no lacing. Aroma: malts, pale malt,Citrus, straw
Taste: malts, peach, honey,some hops(citrus and pine). Moperate sweatband bitter.
Medium body, below average carbonation.

OK, with a flawed appearance. I expected a bit more.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Brud Hoppenheimer ].Slow gusher !! Light unclear medium yellow color with a large to huge, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, sweet malt, fruity malt, moderate hoppy, citrus, fruity hops, moderate yeasty, yeast - dough. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration, citrus, fruity hops, pale malt, cookie, sweet malt, yeast, fruity yeast. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160903]
 7-3-6-3-13

0,33l fles uitgeschonken dik troebel geeloranje bier met een crème kraag. Ipa haal ik er niet het uit kols h ook niet verder geen verkeerd bier redelijk moutig met wat banaan pruim en een stoffige smaak. Volle body met een afdronk met rijpe mandarijnen. We erg aan de prijs voor het type bier

0.33 l bottle from Tabaks Wijndiscount & Bierwinkel, best before November 2016. Clear, golden yellow with a huge, foamy, slowly diminishing, white head. Fruity-grassy, sligthly floral aroma of tangerine, pear, peach, straw, some honey and hints of pine. Sweetish-fruity, slightly grassy-floral taste of peach, tangerine, straw, some honey and hints of pine, followed by a short, medium bitter, yeasty, slightly grassy finish. Thin to medium body, smooth mouthfeel, very lively carbonation. Nice!
Strange beer, but nice. Hoppy, milky, strawberry lemonadey. Backlog from 2015/02/27.

Pours a hazy orangey amber, topped with a big frothy off-white head, weak retention. Mildy fruity aroma, slightly musty and cellar-like. Mildly biscuity. Taste sweet and fruity. Peppery finish. Herbal with mild bitterness, a bit yeasty. Slightly soury in the finish. Easily drinkable and enjoyable.
Bottle 330 ml. Hazy orange-yellow color, average white foam. Aroma: yeast, spicy and fruity hops. Taste: citrus, yeast, malt, a little watery.

Eerste wat opvalt is de hopgeur, een knisperend fris geluid bij het inschenken: veelbelovend. Maar zodra ik een slok neem valt mij de afwezigheid van smaak op. Er zijn wat hoppige tonen, wat mout, hij is fris, maar de smaak verdwijnt na een paar seconden en er blijft de bekende grassige hopsmaak over. Te waterig, weinig tot geen body, tegenvaller.
Hazy orange colour. Hint of sweet orange in the aroma. Initial floral hoppiness rounding off with a creamy maltiness. Highly sessionable!

Bottle bought at Volkshotel drank at Sjoerds. Brewed at Naeckte Brouwers. Cloudy greyish golden with medium sized white head. Fresh baked white bread, strawberry lemonade, lime, raw vegetables (salad even), bitter herbs. Light sweet with some sourness and dry bitter finish. Very strange mouthfeel, hard to describe, like very sour powdered candy. Medium bodied. Unusual but not bad.
330 mml bottle tasted at home on 17/01/2014. The colour is a mix between orange and brown, strange colour for me. Soft carbonation and nice white head. The label is delightful!!!!

Hazy beige colour, white head. Aroma of hops, citrus, yeast and bread. Hop bitter flavour, malts, citrus and lemon zest. Finish hops and citrus peel. Quite nice!
(From 33cL bottle @ weekly tasting. Thanks for sharing, DutchDrebus!)

Bottle @ home shared by me. Got this one from my secret sinterklaas Borresteijn. Hazy peachy colour with a mediun sized, creamy white head. Smells hoppy, fresh, fruity, some grapefruit, sweet.. Pretty nice. Tastes hoppy, fresh, peach, sweet, fruity.. Pretty nice! Thin to medium body, slightly fizzy carbo.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2013 Bottle shared by Dutchdrebus @ weekly tasting. Clear yellow orange color, medium sized white head that lasts for quite a while. Aroma has a lot more hops than one would expect. Tastes a lot more hoppy too! Quite a lot of hops and fruityness in both the aroma and the flavor. Not really a kolsch anymore, tastes more like an APA to me. Nevertheless, quite a nice beer.

Bottle courtesy of Deanso. Poured a cloudy medium amber with a big frothy white head. The aroma is big grassy hop. The flavour is medium bitter with some hoppy, grassy, liqourice, fruity notes on the very complex, smooth and refreshing palate. I looked at the reviews before I opened this bottle and thought surely not. However, they were right. This is a great beer and so untypically Dutch! Keep up the good work.

Opening this bottle was a lot of fun, you saw the flakes of yeast spurt opwards. Took a while for it to bubble over, but I was on time. Awesome aroma, ugly cloudy beer but thats besides the point. Extremely weird beer, a Koelschpee-eh. The Cascade seems to get through the most with citrussy, pineapple like flavors. Guest brewed at the 7 Deugden, but the best beer ever to come through those doors.

Bottle. Pours brown-orange with a bit white head.Hazy! Greatly balanced brew with a heavy maltbase and just enough hops to lighten things up without taking over too much. Notes of red orange, chocolate and grape.

Bottled, BB March 2014, I think bottled a year before. Large sample. Slight hazy golden color, medium off-white head, longlasting. Aroma has some grassy hop, grapefruit, hint of citrus, some sweetness from malts, slight grainy. Medium bitterness in taste, bit malty as well. Good bodied for a Kolsch. Not as crisp and dry perhaps, but much more flavor. So definitely not a classic Kolsch, but that can only be a good thing as most Kolsch are a bit boring. Great head retention, good carbonation. Nice balance between the malts and the hops. Very nice brew!

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Aroma is bread, herbal, hops and some of the amarillo coming through. Taste has quite some of the herbal hops with a quite bitter finish. Medium body and carbo.

33cl bottle from ABCbeers.
Thick white head. Slightly hazy blond pour. Lovely smooth hoppy aftertaste. Well done!
Poured a hazy medium amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of zesty citrus with underlying malt. Medium sweet, flavour of red berries with a lingering sweet end.

33 cl bottle from De Bierkoning. Light amber color, hazy. Fluffy, off white head with good retention. Aromas of flowery hopps, grain/malt, a little fruit, with some malty sweetness retronasal. Flavor is moderately bitter with a little malty sweetness for balance. Body is light, but not too thin. Finishes dry and bitter. Very refreshing, flavorful  and highly drinkable beer.

Bottle. Golden color, cloudy. Floral citric soft hoparoma. Floral citric yeasty hopbitter flavor, lingering on in the aftertaste. Hopfenkölsch?? At least it is a well brewed hoppy ale. Very promising!

33cl Bottle at In de Wildeman. Hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma of citrus and floral hops, light fruity touch, crisp malts, sweet but not sugary. Flavour is light to medium-sweet, pale malts, floral sweetness, citrus, grass, some tropical fruits, nice subtle but firm bitter finish. Light-bodied, soft mouthfeel. Nice quaffer.
